contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox protected area | name = Idalia | alt_name = | iucn_category = II | photo = | photo_alt = | photo_caption = | photo_width = | map = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map_width = | location = [[South West Queensland]], Australia | nearest_city = | lat_d = 24 | lat_m = 57 | lat_s = 31 | lat_NS = S | long_d = 144 | long_m = 41 | long_s = 50 | long_EW = E | coords_ref = | type = landmark | region = AU | area = | established = 1990 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | governing_body = Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service | world_heritage_site = | url = }} '''Idalia''' is a national park in [[South West Queensland]], [[Australia]], 893 km west of [[Brisbane]]. Idalia National Park is located near the town of [[Blackall, Queensland|Blackall]] in the Queensland [[outback]]. The park protects 144,000 hectares of [[mulga lands]] with conservation value.<ref name="herqldout">{{Cite book |title=Heritage Trails of the Queensland Outback |last=[[Environmental Protection Agency (Queensland)]] |year=2002 |publisher=State of Queensland |isbn=0-7345-1040-3 |pages=162–163 }}</ref> Idalia National Park was opened in 1990 by [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Prince Phillip]].<ref name="herqldout"/> The national park is home to many distinctly Australian species of flora and fauna, including wallaroos, red and grey kangaroos, swamp wallabies, black-striped wallabies, yellow-footed rock-wallabies and endangered bridled nailtail wallabies. Contained within the park are a number of Aboriginal heritage sites, including artefact scatters, stone arrangements and camp sites. Also found in the park are the ruins of two historic homesteads; Idalia and Collabara.<ref name="herqldout"/> ==Facilities== There is no accommodation available onsite however camping is allowed at designated sites. ==Access== Access to the park is only available via four-wheel drive. In times of heavy rainfall access into and out of the park is not possible. ==Fact sheet== *''Area:'' 1440.00 km² *''[[geographic coordinates|Coordinates]]'': {{Coord|24|57|31|S|144|41|50|E|type:landmark_region:AU}} *''Date of establishment:'' 1990 *''Managing authorities:'' Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service *''[[World Conservation Union|IUCN]] category:'' II ==See also== {{Portal|Queensland}} * [[Protected areas of Queensland (Australia)]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{National Parks of Queensland}} [[Category:National parks of Queensland]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1990]] [[Category:South West Queensland]] {{Queensland-national-park-stub}}
